newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft surges after stock split.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft surges after stock split.

text.p: Microsoft Corp's shares surged about seven percent on Monday, the first day of trading after a two-for-one stock split.
Microsoft was up 5-3/8 at 81-3/4 in late trading on the Nasdaq, where it was the most active issue with more than 11.7 million shares changing hands.
Analysts said the split, announced November 12, apparently attracted retail investors to the stock.

"There doesn't seem to be any fundamental news today," said analyst Scott McAdams of Ragen MacKenzie. "My guess is that this is being driven by retail investors trying to take advantage of the new lower price of the stock."
Microsoft stock has nearly doubled this year and is up 20 percent in the last month alone, raising questions among some analysts about whether the computer software company is overvalued.
